parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A light, an illuminator, perhaps the sun; a star; brilliancy. From phos; an illuminator, i.e. a luminary, or brilliancy.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Jasper; a precious stone. Probably of foreign origin; 'jasper', a gem.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To be clear as crystal, brilliant like crystal. From krustallos; to make ice.
